											who was going to look after you, Derek,
											really for the rest of your childhood.
											And Nanny's great insight, really,
											was to think, here's a child who can't see.

											but perhaps there's time for one encore.
									,"

column12: La gente de TED va a matarme,
pero quizás quede tiempo para un bis.
ama belki bir bis için zaman vardır.
Die Leute von TED werden mich umbringen,
doch vielleicht ist noch Zeit für eine Zugabe.

So this is one of Derek's heroes.
											It's the great Art Tatum —
DP: Art Tatum.
									,"

column12: Este es uno de los héroes de Derek.
Muhteşem Art Tatum — (Amerika'lı ünlü caz piyanisti)
Dies ist eine von Dereks Heldenfiguren.
Es ist der große Art Tatum –

column10: ,In the key of genius,Derek Paravicini and Adam Ockelford,19:38,Autism spectrum disorder,TEDx,disability,live music,music,entertainment"

column1: ,In the key of genius,Derek Paravicini and Adam Ockelford,19:38,Autism spectrum disorder,TEDx,disability,live music,music,entertainment"

AO: — who also was a pianist who couldn't see,
											and also, I think, like Derek,
											thought that all the world was a piano,
											so whenever Art Tatum plays something,
											it sounds like there's three pianos in the room.
											And here is Derek's take on Art Tatum's take on "Tiger Rag."
									,"

column12: AO: quien era también un pianista ciego,
He aquí la versión de Derek de

column1: El paso del tigre"" (Tiger Rag) de Art Tatum

column12: Adam: O da görmeyen bir piyanistti,
ve sanırım, o da Derek gibi
bütün dünyayı bir piyano olarak görüyordu,
o nedenle Art Tatum ne zaman bir şey çalsa
sanki odada 3 tane piyano varmış gibi ses çıkıyor.
ve işte Art Tatum'un ""Tiger Rag""ine Derek'in yorumu.
AO: – der auch ein Pianist war,
und, ich denke, genauso wie Derek
dachte, dass die ganze Welt ein Klavier sei.
Wann immer Art Tatum also etwas gespielt hat,
klang es, als ob drei Klaviere im Raum wären.

column1: von Art Tatums Interpretation von „Tiger Rag“.
